com.github.daytron.simpledialogfx.dialog

Class Dialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.stage.Window
      • javafx.stage.Stage
        • com.github.daytron.simpledialogfx.dialog.Dialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.event.EventTarget, javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class Dialog
extends javafx.stage.Stage
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The controller class for building any derivatives of dialogs
    Author:
    Ryan Gilera

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dialog

        public Dialog(DialogType dialogType,
              String header,
              String details)
        Constructs a dialog with specified DialogType, header text and details text.

        Note: Using an exception dialog will overwrite the header's and details' texts with predefined exception header message and Exception object's class name respectively. Since there is no exception given (will yield to null), it will result to pre-built error texts in exception dialog's header, details and trace messages.

        Default values:

        • DialogStyle is set to NATIVE
        • Title is set to an empty String
        • HeaderColorStyle is set to DEFAULT
        • Exception object is set to NULL
        Parameters:
        dialogType - The dialog type to be created
        header - The text for the colored header label
        details - The text for the message details label

      • Dialog

        public Dialog(DialogType dialogType,
              HeaderColorStyle headerColorStyle,
              String header,
              String details)
        Constructs a dialog with specified DialogType, HeaderColorStyle, header text and details text.

        Note: Using an exception dialog will overwrite the header's and details' texts with predefined exception header message and Exception object's class name respectively. Since there is no exception given (will yield to null), it will result to pre-built error texts in exception dialog's header, details and trace messages.

        Default values:

        • DialogStyle is set to NATIVE
        • Title is set to an empty String
        • Exception object is set to NULL
        Parameters:
        dialogType - The dialog type to be created
        headerColorStyle - The chosen color style for the header
        header - The text for the colored header label
        details - The text for the message details label

      • Dialog

        public Dialog(DialogType dialogType,
              DialogStyle dialogStyle,
              String header,
              String details)
        Constructs a dialog with specified DialogType, DialogStyle, header text and details text.

        Note: Using an exception dialog will overwrite the header's and details' texts with predefined exception header message and Exception object's class name respectively. Since there is no exception given (will yield to null), it will result to pre-built error texts in exception dialog's header, details and trace messages.

        Default values:

        • Title is set to an empty String
        • HeaderColorStyle is set to DEFAULT
        • Exception object is set to NULL
        Parameters:
        dialogType - The dialog type to be created
        dialogStyle - The dialog style to be created
        header - The text for the colored header label
        details - The text for the message details label

      • Dialog

        public Dialog(DialogType dialogType,
              DialogStyle dialogStyle,
              String title,
              String header,
              String details)
        Constructs a dialog with specified DialogType, DialogStyle, title, header text and details text.

        Note: Using an exception dialog will overwrite the header's and details' texts with predefined exception header message and Exception object's class name respectively. Since there is no exception given (will yield to null), it will result to pre-built error texts in exception dialog's header, details and trace messages.

        Default values:

        • HeaderColorStyle is set to DEFAULT
        • Exception object is set to NULL
        Parameters:
        dialogType - The dialog type to be created
        dialogStyle - The dialog style to be created
        title - The window title of the dialog
        header - The text for the colored header label
        details - The text for the message details label

      • Dialog

        public Dialog(DialogType dialogType,
              String title,
              String header,
              String details)
        Constructs a dialog with specified DialogType, title, header text and details text.

        Note: Using an exception dialog will overwrite the header's and details' texts with predefined exception header message and Exception object's class name respectively. Since there is no exception given (will yield to null), it will result to pre-built error texts in exception dialog's header, details and trace messages.

        Default values:

        • DialogStyle is set to NATIVE
        • HeaderColorStyle is set to DEFAULT
        • Exception object is set to NULL
        Parameters:
        dialogType - The dialog type to be created
        title - The window title of the dialog
        header - The text for the colored header label
        details - The text for the message details label

      • Dialog

        public Dialog(Exception exception)
        Constructs an exception dialog with a specified Exception object.

        Default values:

        • DialogType is set to EXCEPTION
        • DialogStyle is set to NATIVE
        • Title is set to an empty String
        • Header text is set to a pre-built exception message from DialogText.EXCEPTION_HEADER
        • Details text is set to the Exception object's class name
        • HeaderColorStyle is set to DEFAULT
        Parameters:
        exception - An exception object to be displayed

      • Dialog

        public Dialog(String title,
              Exception exception)
        Constructs an exception dialog with specified title and an Exception object.

        Default values:

        • DialogType is set to EXCEPTION
        • DialogStyle is set to NATIVE
        • Header text is set to a pre-built exception message from DialogText.EXCEPTION_HEADER
        • Details text is set to the Exception object's class name
        • HeaderColorStyle is set to DEFAULT
        Parameters:
        title - The window title of the dialog
        exception - An exception object to be displayed

        Default values:

        • Title is set to an empty String

      • Dialog

        public Dialog(DialogStyle dialogStyle,
              String title,
              Exception exception)
        Constructs an exception dialog with specified DialogStyle, title and an Exception object.

        Default values:

        • DialogType is set to EXCEPTION
        • Header text is set to a pre-built exception message from DialogText.EXCEPTION_HEADER
        • Details text is set to the Exception object's class name
        • HeaderColorStyle is set to DEFAULT
        Parameters:
        dialogStyle - The dialog style to be created
        title - The window title of the dialog
        exception - An exception object to be displayed

      • Dialog

        public Dialog(DialogType dialogType,
              DialogStyle dialogStyle,
              String title,
              String header,
              String details,
              Exception exception)
        Constructs a dialog with specified DialogType, DialogStyle, title, header text, details text and exception object.

        Note: Using exception dialog will overwrite the header's and details' texts with predefined exception header message and Exception object's class name respectively. If the given exception object is NULL , it will result to pre-built error texts in exception dialog's header, details and trace texts.

        Exception object is ignored, using any other dialog types other than Exception dialog with a non-null exception object given.

        Default values:

        • HeaderColorStyle is set to DEFAULT
        Parameters:
        dialogType - The type of dialog to build
        dialogStyle - The dialog style to be created
        title - The dialog window title
        header - The text for the colored header label
        details - The text for the message details label
        exception - An exception object to be displayed

      • Dialog

        public Dialog(DialogType dialogType,
              DialogStyle dialogStyle,
              String title,
              String header,
              HeaderColorStyle headerColorStyle,
              String details,
              Exception exception)
        Constructs a dialog using all possible parameters. Allows full explicit customization for dialog building with specified DialogType, DialogStyle, title, header text, HeaderColorStyle, details text and exception object.

        Note: Using exception dialog will overwrite the header's and details' texts with predefined exception header message and Exception object's class name respectively. If the given exception object is NULL , it will result to pre-built error texts in exception dialog's header, details and trace texts.

        Exception object is ignored, using any other dialog types other than Exception dialog with a non-null exception object given.

        Parameters:
        dialogType - The type of dialog to build
        dialogStyle - The dialog style to be created
        title - The dialog window title
        header - The text for the colored header label
        headerColorStyle - The chosen color style for the header
        details - The text for the message details label
        exception - An exception object to be displayed

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(URL location,
                       ResourceBundle resources)
        Initializes the dialog. Sets default focus to OK button. Wraps the text for details message label and apply the user-defined header and details. Filter the behavior for the exception dialog for a null and non-null exception object given. Applies corresponding header background css style.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known
        resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

        public final void setHeaderColorStyle(HeaderColorStyle headerColorStyle)

        Parameters:
        headerColorStyle - A HeaderColorStyle option containing a color scheme.

      • setCustomHeaderColorStyle

        public final void setCustomHeaderColorStyle(String colorStyle)
        Applies custom JavaFX CSS background color style on header label. Improper JavaFX CSS declaration will result to nothing.
        Parameters:
        colorStyle - A JavaFX CSS style declaration in String format.

      • setFontSize

        public void setFontSize(int font_size)
        Sets both font sizes in pixels for the header and the details label with a single font size integer parameter given.
        Parameters:
        font_size - Font size in pixels for both header and details labels in pixels

      • getException

        public final Exception getException()
        Retrieves the exception object, if the dialog does not hold an exception, return null.
        Returns:
        The Exception object

      • getTextEntry

        public final String getTextEntry()
        Retrieves user input text from the Input Text Dialog, if no text is given or a different dialog is used, then return string value is empty as the default value. Returns an empty String if the dialog created is not an input dialog.
        Returns:
        The string input text entered from the Input Text Dialog

      • getTextField

        public final javafx.scene.control.TextField getTextField()
        Retrieves the TextField object. Allows user to customize FX TextField object. This is only for input's text field dialog. Returns null if the dialog created is not an input dialog.
        Returns:
        The TextField object
